name: Bajra Roti
history: Bajra Roti, also known as Pearl Millet Bread, is a traditional Indian flatbread. It's especially popular in the states of Rajasthan and Gujarat.
description: Bajra Roti is a nutritious and gluten-free flatbread made from bajra (pearl millet) flour. It is known for its rich, nutty flavor and is typically served with vegetables or curries.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine bajra flour and salt. Gradually add warm water and knead into a soft dough.

instructions.title: Roll the Roti
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Flatten each ball and roll it into a thin circle, using bajra flour for dusting.

instructions.title: Cook the Roti
instructions.description: Heat a tawa or griddle. Cook each roti until brown spots appear on both sides. Apply ghee or butter if desired.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the bajra roti hot with a side of vegetables, dal, or curry.

tips: Keep the dough moist as bajra flour tends to dry out quickly.
Rolling bajra roti requires some skill, as the dough is gluten-free and delicate.
variations: Add finely chopped herbs or spices to the dough for added flavor.
Mix bajra flour with wheat flour for a different texture.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored for 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a tawa before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a tawa or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional thali with accompaniments like pickle, yogurt, and chutney.
